page.title: 05HAREWOOD HOUSE:BIRD GARDEN
page.content: The Bird Garden is the most popular attraction of the Harewood grounds.It began in 1968 after a visit to Bourton-on-Water where there is another Garden.It was opened on March 31st 1970 after Lord and Lady Harewood thought of the idea. It has an area of four and a half acres with 170 species of birds.Since it opened, it has acquired several mammals,reptiles and amphibians.There are 4 staff and a curator.Birds come from all countries,but common birds have now been phased out. The emphasis is on breeding endangered species,so 95% of all their birds are captive bred.There are special diets for all birds which help them to grow and breed.Vets are on call 24 hours a day and visit once a month.
